Projects

Projects (4)
Reestruturação do Programa de Pesquisa em Biodiversidade e Ecossistema
Project
The Research Program on Biodiversity (PPBio) was established in 2004 at the Ministry of Science and Technology (MCT current MCTIC) with the main objective of coordinating regional skills to promote scientific development, to educate and train human resources and strengthen institutions in area of research and development in biological diversity. These objectives were in line with the Guidelines of the National Biodiversity Policy, published by decree in 2002. Currently, there is a strong demand for provision of scientific information to guide and implement national policies in the environmental area, and in this scenario, the program needs to take a leading position nationwide. Based on the experience gained during 12 years of PPBio's existence, this proposal aims to promote discussions that will lead to the restructuring of the National Research Program on Biodiversity and Ecosystems, multidisciplinary nature program that also will be guided by the need to generate information that befit the government commitments made and current scenarios of public policies.
View
The Psychodidae from the Brazilian Semiarid Region
Project
View
Diversity and distribution of the Brazilian semiarid arthropods
Project
This project aims to map as many records as possible, of as many species as possible of a myriad of arthropod groups occurring in the Brazilian semiarid domain. This huge database will be used to map sampling gaps and provide maps of the priority areas for sampling, besides combined maps for taxonomic groups which shares the same sampling biases. This approach will allow the proposition of research networks of different arthropod taxa researchers which need to sample in the same areas, thus reducing expedition costs and maximizing the use of project funds.
